intro: Lapsana pisidica, commonly known as the common vetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm. The plant features trifoliate leaves and produces small, yellow,蝶形花 (butterfly-shaped) flowers arranged in racemes. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and is often found in disturbed soils, roadsides, and waste areas. Lapsana pisidica is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it beneficial for soil enrichment.
